result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Duncan A Robertson was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

for Examination
Order for Examination

10:40 AM  Cases called: 15CF371, 15CF382, 15CF435, and 15CM512. Defendant Duncan A Robertson in court, in custody at Columbia County Jail with attorney Karl A Green.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video Zoom. Additional comments for Motion by Atty Green. Defendant has been in jail since Dec. of 2019. Atty Green stated defendant is not able to get into Mendota, there has been no transport. He is not getting the treatment he needs. Request is for defendant to be placed back on conditional release to allow him to get treatment. State requested clarification if Atty Green is requesting conditional release be reinstated, or is he requesting termination of commitment order. State opposed either request at this time with argument. Felt he is a risk to himself and the community. Atty Green restated argument. Court under State Statue 971.17(4)(c) appointed an examiner to examine defendant. Report is due within 30 days of todays date.  A new hearing will be set to address the issue after the report is filed. Defendant is to remain in custody.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2020 at 01:00 pm.
Motion hearing on July 21, 2020 at 10:30 am.
Petition for Reinstatement of Conditional Release filed by Atty Karl Green
Request for hearing for Reinstatement of Conditional Release filed by Atty Karl Green
Order on Petition to Revoke Conditional Release.
Subsequent Order for Placement

11:35 AM Defendant Duncan A Robertson in court, in custody with attorney Karl A Green.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 15CF371, 15CF382, 15CF435, & 15CM512. Atty Green stated he just received the adjusted summary today. Has reviewed them. Atty Green agreed the defendant has violated the rules of conditional release. Counsel agrees that inpatient treatment is necessary. Discussion was held regarding how long defendant must be in treatment before petitioning the court for conditional release. Court in recess 12:02/12:08 Court resumed. Appearances the same. Atty Green explained during the recess to the defendant how the inpatient program works. Defendant is willing to proceed forward with todays hearing. Orders are to be sent and the jail will coordinate when a bed is available. Court ordered inpatient treatment for the defendant. Conditional release is revoked at this time. Clerk will prepare the orders for the Judges signature. 12:12 PM
